alert.note: Alert for Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 10:23PM CDT until May 12 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Callahan, Coleman, Concho, Runnels and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...storms from Mason to Brady to Ballinger were moving north, while storms from Talpa to Coleman to just north of Lake Brownwood were moving north. All these storms were converging on Coleman and Brown Counties. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ballinger, Winters, Paint Rock, Eden, Cross Plains, Tuscola, Lawn, Benoit, Crews, Ivie Reservoir Near Concho Park Marina, Hatchel, Rowena, Millersview, Lowake, Bradshaw, Oplin, Eola, Dudley, Rowden and Eula. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 89 crossing Scott Hollow, FM 1929 crossing Fuzzy Creek, FM 1086 crossing Red Lake Creek, CR 348 crossing Coyote Creek, County Road 244 crossing North Prong Pecan Bayou, County Road 241 crossing North Prong Pecan Bayou, crossings along County Road 4071, County Road 244 crossing South Prong Pecan Bayou, crossings along County Road 249 and CR 116 crossing Pony Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
